page.title: 11Education and Clubs
page.content: There is no educational provision in Kynnersley.The Primary school closed in 1961,children up to the age of eleven,educated in the state sector attend the village school in Preston,just one mile away.On reaching secondary school age children are bussed to Charlton school in Wellington,the bus picking up at 8 o'clock.Pupils staying in full time education after 16 attend a sixth form college or Telford College of Arts and Technology in Wellington.There are a number of pupils attending schools in the private sector either as day pupils in nearby puplic schools (Shrewsbury,Wrekin College ) or as boarders outside the area.A number of families have older children attending higher education outside the area. There is a Mother and Toddlers club on Fridays in Kynnersley Village hall.
